org.jtrim.collections

Interface RefCollection<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of the elements in this collection
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.Collection<E>, java.lang.Iterable<E>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    RefList<E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RefLinkedList

    public interface RefCollection<E>
extends java.util.Collection<E>
    Defines a collection whose elements can be referenced independently. These element references remain valid even after the collection was modified.

    The elements of this collection can easily and efficiently be replaced and removed.

    Thread safety

    Implementations of this interface are not required to be thread-safe and in general cannot be modified concurrently by multiple concurrent threads. However reading by multiple concurrent threads are allowed. Note that accessing the element references of a RefCollection is equivalent to accessing the collection itself regarding thread safety.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this interface are required to be synchronization transparent, so they can be called in any context (e.g.: while holding a lock).
    See Also:
    RefLinkedList, RefList

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  RefCollection.ElementRef<E>
      Defines a reference to an element of a RefCollection.

    • Method Summary

      Methods

      Adds a new element to this collection and returns a reference to the newly added element.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.Collection

        add, addAll, clear, contains, containsAll, equals, hashCode, isEmpty, iterator, remove, removeAll, retainAll, size, toArray, toArray

    • Method Detail

      • addGetReference

        RefCollection.ElementRef<E> addGetReference(E element)
        Adds a new element to this collection and returns a reference to the newly added element. The newly added element can later be replaced or removed by the returned reference even if this collection was modified since then.
        Parameters:
        element - the new element to be added to this collection. This argument can be null only if this collection supports null elements.
        Returns:
        the reference which can be used to replace or remove the newly added element. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - thrown if this collection does not support adding new elements to it (possibly because it is readonly)
        java.lang.ClassCastException - thrown if the class of the specified element prevents it from being added to this collection. Note that since generics are implemented using erasure, this cannot always be verified.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified element is null and this collection does not permit null elements
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if some property of the element prevents it from being added to this collection
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - thrown if the element cannot be added at this time due to insertion restrictions

      • findReference

        RefCollection.ElementRef<E> findReference(E element)
        Returns an element reference to the specified reference found in this collection. The element is looked up based on the equals method of the elements the same way as the contains method does. In case there the element is contained in this collection multiple times, reference to any of them can be returned.
        Parameters:
        element - the element to which a reference is to be returned. This argument can be null if this collection permits null elements. In case this implementation does not permit null elements but accept null for this argument, it must return null if null is passed for this argument.
        Returns:
        an element reference to the specified reference found in this collection or null if the specified element is not in this collections
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - implementations may throw this exception if this collection does not permit null elements. However even in this case, an implementation is not required to raise this exception.
